section.name: Keyboard Shortcuts in soapUI
section.p: soapUI supports a number of keyboard shortcuts in order to make your life easier.

subsection.name: Global Actions
subsection.p: The following shortcuts are available for most items in soapUI:

tr.td: Copies or Clones the selected item.

subsection.name: Main Menu Actions
subsection.p: The following shortcuts are available for main menu actions;

tr.td: Creates a new soapUI project in the workspace.
Imports an existing project into the workspace.
Select next. Selects next window in the soapUI desktop.
Saves the entire workspace and exits soapUI.

subsection.name: Desktop Actions
subsection.p: The following shortcuts are available for working with the soapUI desktop;

tr.td: Close Current. Closes the active window in the soapUI desktop
Close Others. Closes all windows but the active window in the soapUI desktop.
Close All. Closes all windows in the soapUI desktop.
Select next. Selects next window in the soapUI desktop.

subsection.name: Project Actions
subsection.p: The following actions are available when an Project node is selected in the Navigator

tr.td: Adds a new WSDL from an URL
Adds a new WSDL from a local File
Prompts to save the project to a new file

subsection.name: Interface Actions
subsection.p: The following actions are available when an Interface node is selected in the Navigator

tr.td: Validate the interface with the WS-I validation tools
Saves the entire WSDL and included and imported files to a local directory
Reloads the definition for this interface and its operations

subsection.name: Operation Actions
subsection.p: The following actions are available when an Operation node is selected in the Navigator

tr.td: Creates a new request for the Operation.

subsection.name: Request Actions
subsection.p: The following actions are available when an Request node is selected in the Navigator

tr.td: Adds the request to a TestCase

subsection.name: Working with Requests and Responses
subsection.p: The following shortcuts are general shortcuts when working in the Request Editor;

tr.td: Submits the request to the specified endpoint.
Changes the orientation of the request/response splitter
Validate the contained messages' XML and against its operations message definition.
Validate the current request/response messages against the WS-I Basic Profile (requires a response).
Delete line. Deletes the current Line in the XML Editor.
Prompts to save the contents of the editor to a file.
